summary.long: Ezra is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: During the first year of Cyrus, king of Persia, in fulfillment of the message from the Lord spoken through Jeremiah, the Lord prompted Cyrus, king of Persia, to make this proclamation throughout his entire kingdom, which was also released in written form:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
An Official Statement
from Cyrus, King of Persia
All of the kingdoms of the earth have been given to me by the Lord God of Heaven, and he specifically charged me to build a temple for him in Jerusalem, which is in Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, who among the Lord’s people trusts in his God? Whoever among this group wishes to do so may travel to Jerusalem of Judah to rebuild the Temple of the Lord God of Israel, the God of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Furthermore, everyone who wishes to repatriate from any territory where he now resides is to receive assistance from his fellow residents in the form of silver, gold, equipment, and pack animals, in addition to voluntary offerings for the Temple of the God of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In response, the heads of the families of Judah and Benjamin, the priests and descendants of Levi, and all those who had been prompted by God, prepared to travel to rebuild the Temple of the Lord, which was in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all of their neighbors equipped the travelers with silver, gold, equipment, pack animals, and valuable goods, in addition to voluntary offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: King Cyrus also brought out from storage the service instruments from the Temple of the Lord, which Nebuchadnezzar had taken from Jerusalem and had placed in the temple of his gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cyrus, king of Persia, had them brought out to Mithredath the Treasurer, had them inventoried, and had them placed in care of Sheshbazzar, governor of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Here is a partial inventory:
Gold dishes: 30
Silver dishes: 1,000
Sacrificial knives: 29
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Gold bowls: 30
Silver bowls of another kind: 410
Miscellaneous instruments: 1,000
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The complete inventory of gold and silver vessels totaled 5,400. Sheshbazzar brought them all to Jerusalem, along with the exiles from Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Here is a list of descendants of the province of Judah who returned from the captivity, from those who had been exiled. Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, had taken them to Babylon. They came back to Jerusalem and Judah, each one to his town,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
along with Zerubbabel, Jeshua, Nehemiah, Seraiah, Reelaiah, Mordecai, Bilshan, Mispar, Bigvai, Rehum, and Baanah. Here is the enumeration of:
The Men of Israel:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Descendants of Parosh: 2,172
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Descendants of Shephatiah: 372
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Descendants of Arah: 775
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Descendants of Pahath-moab; that is, through Jeshua and Joab: 2,812
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Descendants of Elam: 1,254
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Descendants of Zattu: 945
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Descendants of Zaccai: 760
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Descendants of Bani: 642
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Descendants of Bebai: 623
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Descendants of Adonikam: 666
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Descendants of Bigvai: 2,056
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Descendants of Adin: 454
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Descendants of Ater through Hezekiah: 98
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Descendants of Bezai: 323

verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: People from Netophah: 56
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: People from Anathoth: 128
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Descendants of exiles from Azmaveth: 42
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Descendants of exiles from Kiriath-arim; that is, Chephirah and Beeroth: 743
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Descendants of exiles from Magbish: 156
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Descendants of exiles from the other Elam: 1,254
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Descendants of exiles from Harim: 320
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Descendants of exiles from Lod, Hadid, and Ono: 725
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Descendants of exiles from Jericho: 345
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Descendants of exiles from Senaah: 3,630
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Priests:
Descendants of Jedaiah from the household of Jeshua: 973
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Descendants of Immer: 1,052
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Descendants of Pashhur: 1,247
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Descendants of Harim: 1,017
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Descendants of Levi:
Descendants of Jeshua and Kadmiel; that is, descendants of Hodaviah: 74
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Singers:
Descendants of Asaph: 128
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Descendants of the Gatekeepers:
Descendants of Shallum, Ater, Talmon, Akkub, Hatita, and Shobai, totaling: 139
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Temple Servants:
Descendants of Ziha, Hasupha, and Tabbaoth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Descendants of Keros, Siaha, and Padon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Descendants of Lebanah, Hagabah, and Akkub.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Descendants of Hagab, Shalmai, and Hanan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Descendants of Giddel, Gahar, and Reaiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Descendants of Rezin, Nekoda, and Gazzam.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Descendants of Uzza, Paseah, and Besai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Descendants of Asnah, Meunim, and Nephusim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Descendants of Bakbuk, Hakupha, and Harhur.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Descendants of Bazluth, Mehida, and Harsha.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Descendants of Barkos, Sisera, and Temah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Descendants of Neziah and Hatipha.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Descendants of Solomon’s Servants:
Descendants of Sotai, Hassophereth, and Peruda.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Descendants of Jaalah, Darkon, and Giddel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Descendants of Shephatiah, Hattil, Pochereth-hazzebaim, and Ami.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All of the Temple Servants and descendants of Solomon’s servants numbered 392.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Here is a list of returnees from Tel-melah, Tel-harsha, Cherub, Addan, and Immer who could not prove their ancestry and lineage from Israel:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Descendants of Delaiah, Tobiah, and Nekoda: 652
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Descendants of the Priests:
Descendants of Habaiah, Hakkoz, and Barzillai, who married one of the daughters of Barzillai from Gilead and took that name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These people searched for their ancestral registrations but they couldn’t be located. Accordingly, they were assigned an “unclean” status and couldn’t be priests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Governor Zerubbabel also ruled that they shouldn’t eat anything holy until a priest arose with Urim and Thummim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The entire assembly numbered 42,360,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not including 7,337 male and female servants, along with 200 singing men and women.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In addition, they had 736 horses, 245 mules,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: 435 camels, and 6,720 donkeys.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they arrived at the Temple of the Lord in Jerusalem, some of the heads of the families contributed toward building the Temple of God on its former site.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They contributed to the treasury for this work in accordance with their ability: 61,000 golden drachma, 5,000 units of silver, and 100 priestly robes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As a result, the priests, descendants of Levi, certain people, the singers, door-keepers, and the Temple Servants were able to settle in their original cities, with the rest of the Israelis in their cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seven months after the Israelis had settled in their cities, they all gathered together in Jerusalem as a united body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jozadak’s son Jeshua and his brothers got up, along with Shealtiel’s son Zerubbabel and his brothers. They built an altar of the God of Israel in order to offer burnt offerings, as prescribed by the Law of Moses, the man of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even though they feared the people in neighboring regions, they rebuilt the altar where it had stood before. They offered burnt offerings on it to the Lord—burnt offerings both in the morning and in the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They also observed the Festival of Tents as has been prescribed, offering a specific number of daily burnt offerings in accordance with the ordinance of each day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After that, they offered all of the continual burnt offerings and the New Moon sacrifices for all of the designated festivals of the Lord that were being consecrated, along with all the voluntary offerings that were dedicated to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They began to offer burnt offerings to the Lord from the first day of the seventh month, even though the foundation of the Temple of the Lord had not yet been laid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They paid masons and carpenters in cash. They paid the residents of Sidon and Tyre with food, drink, and oil, for them to bring cedar trees by sea from Lebanon to Joppa in accordance with the order they had obtained from Cyrus, king of Persia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Two years and two months after arriving at the site of the Temple of God in Jerusalem, Shealtiel’s son Zerubbabel, Jozadak’s son Jeshua, the relatives of the priests and descendants of Levi, and everyone else who had left the Babylonian captivity for Jerusalem appointed descendants of Levi who were 20 years old and older to oversee the work of the Lord’s Temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At this time Jeshua, along with his children and relatives, and Kadmiel, with his children and the descendants of Judah, joined the family of Henadad with his children and relatives, and the descendants of Levi in overseeing the work on the Temple of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After the builders laid the foundation for the Lord’s Temple, the priests stood in their ministerial robes with trumpets and the descendants of Levi (who were also descendants of Asaph) with cymbals to praise the Lord, according to instructions prepared by David, king of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And they sang in unison to one another, giving thanks to the Lord:
“He is good,
    and his gracious love to Israel endures forever.”
And all the people shouted out loudly in praise to the Lord when the foundation of the Lord’s Temple was laid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a number of the priests, the Levities, and the leading officials of the elders—who were very elderly—had seen the former Temple with their own eyes. When they observed the foundation of the Temple being laid, they wept with a loud voice, while the rest of them shouted for joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As a result, the people couldn’t distinguish between the noise coming from the shouts of joy and the noise coming from the weeping people, because everyone was shouting loudly and could be heard a long way off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the enemies of Judah and Benjamin learned that the descendants of the Babylonian captivity had built their Temple to the Lord, the God of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they approached Zerubbabel and the heads of the families with this message: “Let’s build along with you, because, like you, we seek your God, as do you, and we’ve been making sacrifices to him since the reign of Esarhaddon, king of Assyria, who brought us here.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Zerubbabel, Jeshua, and the rest of the heads of the families of Israel replied, “You have no part in our plans for building a temple to our God, because we alone will build to the Lord, the God of Israel, in accordance with the decree issued by King Cyrus, king of Persia.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this, the non-Israeli inhabitants of the land undermined the people of Judah, harassing them in their construction work
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: by bribing their consultants in order to frustrate their plans throughout the reign of Cyrus, king of Persia until Darius became king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the beginning of the reign of Ahasuerus, they lodged a formal accusation against the inhabitants of Judah and Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
While Artaxerxes was king of Persia, Bishlam, Mithredath, Tabeel, and the rest of their co-conspirators wrote in the Aramaic language and script to King Artaxerxes of Persia.
Aramaic:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Governor Rehum and Shimshai the scribe wrote a letter concerning Jerusalem to King Artaxerxes as follows:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From Governor Rehum
Shimshai the scribe
The rest of their colleagues—
Judges, envoys, officials, Persians, the people of Erech, the Babylonians, the people of Susa (that is, the Elamites)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and many other nations whom the great and honorable Osnappar deported and resettled in Samaria and in the rest of the province beyond the Euphrates River.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is the text of the letter they sent.
To: King Artaxerxes
From: Your servants, the men of the province beyond the Euphrates River.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: May the king be advised that the Jews who came from you to us have reached Jerusalem and are rebuilding a rebellious and wicked city, having completed its walls and repaired its foundations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: May the king be further advised that if this city is rebuilt and its walls erected, its citizens will refuse to pay tributes, taxes, and tariffs, thereby restricting royal revenues.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, because we are royal employees and are committed to preserving the reputation of the king, we have written to the king and have declared its contents to be true,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: urging that a search may be made in the official registers of your predecessors. You will discover in the registers that this city is a rebellious city, that it is damaging to both kings and provinces, that it has been moved to sedition from time immemorial, and that because of this it was destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We certify to the king that if this city is rebuilt and its walls completed, you will lose your land holdings in the province beyond the Euphrates River.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The king replied:
To: Governor Rehum, Shimshai the scribe, and their colleagues living in Samaria, and the remainder living beyond the Euphrates River.
Greetings:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The memorandum you sent to us has been read and carefully considered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pursuant to my edict, an investigation has been undertaken. It is noted that this city has fomented rebellion against kings from time immemorial, and that rebellion and sedition has occurred in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Powerful kings have reigned over Jerusalem, including ruling over all lands beyond the Euphrates River. Furthermore, taxes, tribute, and tolls have been paid to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Accordingly, issue an order to force these men to cease their work so that this city is not rebuilt until you receive further notice from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be diligent and take precautions so that you do not neglect your responsibility in this matter. Why should the kingdom sustain any more damage?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as a copy of the letter from King Artaxerxes was read to Rehum, to Shimshai the scribe, and to their colleagues, they traveled quickly to Jerusalem and compelled the Jews to cease by force of arms.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As a result, work on the Temple of God in Jerusalem ceased and did not begin again until the second year of the reign of King Darius of Persia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time, the prophets Haggai and Iddo’s son Zechariah prophesied specifically to the Jews in Judah and Jerusalem in the name of the God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Shealtiel’s son Zerubbabel and Jozadak’s son Jeshua restarted construction of the Temple of God in Jerusalem. And the prophets of God were there supporting them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Right about then, Trans-Euphrates Governor Tattenai, Shethar-bozenai, and their colleagues approached and challenged them. They asked, “Who authorized you to build this Temple and to reconstruct this wall?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In answer, we responded with a list of the names of the men who were building the structure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God watched over the Jewish leaders, who could not be forced to stop working until Darius received a report and responded in reply.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Here is a copy of the letter that Trans-Euphrates Governor Tattenai, Shethar-bozenai, and his colleagues the Trans-Euphrates Persians sent to King Darius.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The letter sent to him was written like this:
To: King Darius:
Greetings!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is to inform the king that we traveled to the Temple of the great God in the Judean province, which is being built with large stones and reinforced with wooden beams in its walls. The work proceeds diligently and is in capable hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We asked the elders, “Who authorized you to build this Temple and to reinforce these walls?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We also asked them their names so that we could certify the identities of their leaders to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In answer they responded, “We are servants of the God of heaven and earth, and are rebuilding the Temple that was built many years ago by a great king of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But because our predecessors provoked the God of Heaven to become angry, he handed them over to the control of King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon, the Chaldean who destroyed this Temple and transported the people to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “However, during King Cyrus’ first year—that same King Cyrus of Babylon—issued a decree to reconstruct this Temple of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He delivered into the care of Sheshbazzar (whom he appointed governor) the gold and silver utensils that Nebuchadnezzar had taken from the Jerusalem Temple and brought into the Babylonian temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And Cyrus told him, ‘Take these utensils, go to Jerusalem, and carry them to the Temple, after the Temple of God has been built in its appropriate place.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then this very same Sheshbazzar arrived and laid the foundations for the Temple of God in Jerusalem. Since that time until now the Temple has been under construction and is not yet completed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Accordingly, with your approval we suggest that a search be conducted within the king’s treasury at Babylon to verify whether or not King Cyrus ever issued such a decree to reconstruct this Temple of God in Jerusalem. Then please notify us concerning the king’s pleasure in this matter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then King Darius issued an order to search the Hall of Records where the Babylonian archives were stored.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The following was found written on a scroll in Ecbatana at the summer palace of the province of Media:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Date: First year of Cyrus the King
From: King Cyrus
Subject: The Temple of God in Jerusalem
Let the Temple be rebuilt where they offered sacrifices. Let the foundations thereof be laid with a height of 60 cubits and a width of 60 cubits,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: constructed with three layers of foundation stone interlaced with a row of new timber, the expenses for which are to be paid from the king’s treasury.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Furthermore, let the gold and silver utensils from the Temple of God (that Nebuchadnezzar took from the Temple in Jerusalem and carried off to Babylon) be brought back to the Temple at Jerusalem and restored to their respective places in the Temple of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To: Tattenai, Trans-Euphrates Governor, Shethar-bozenai, and your colleagues living beyond the Euphrates River.
Stay away from there!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Leave the work on this Temple of God alone!
Let the Jewish governor and the Jewish leaders build this Temple of God on its site.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Furthermore, I hereby decree what you are to do for the Jewish leaders who are building this Temple of God: you are to pay the expenses of these men out of the king’s assets from taxes collected beyond the River so that they are not hindered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And be sure that you don’t fail to provide their daily needs—including young bulls, rams, and lambs for the burnt offerings of the God of Heaven, along with wheat, salt, wine, and oil, as the priests in Jerusalem tell you—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so they may approach the God of Heaven with fragrant sacrifices and pray for the life of this king and his sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I hereby also decree that whoever shall alter the wording of this edict, let his residence be torn down for timber to build a gallows, hang him on it, and turn his home into an outhouse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And may the God who causes his Name to rest there destroy any king or people who might attempt to destroy this Temple of God in Jerusalem.
I, Darius, have issued this decree. Let it be carried out quickly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because of what King Darius had mandated, Tattenai, the Trans-Euphrates Governor, Shethar-bozenai, and their colleagues carried out his orders quickly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And so the Jewish leaders continued their building, and prospered because of the prophecies of Haggai the prophet and Iddo’s son Zechariah. They completed the rebuilding in accordance with the commandment from the God of Israel and the edicts of Cyrus, Darius, and Artaxerxes, king of Persia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Temple was completed on the third day of the month Adar during the sixth year of the reign of King Darius.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Israelis—the priests, the descendants of Levi, and the other related descendants who had returned from captivity—celebrated with joy at the dedication of the Temple of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the dedication offering of the Temple of God, they presented 100 bulls, 200 rams, and 400 lambs, along with a sin offering of twelve male goats for the entire nation of Israel according to the number of the tribes of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Furthermore, they established the priests in their divisions and the descendants of Levi in their positions for the service of God conducted at Jerusalem, as is proscribed in the Book of Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The former exiles observed the Passover on the fourteenth day of the first month
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because the priests and descendants of Levi had purified themselves together—all of them were pure—and they killed the Passover lamb for every former exile, for their relatives the priests, and for themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Israelis who had returned from captivity ate the Passover with all who had consecrated themselves from the uncleanness of the nations of the land in order to seek the Lord God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they observed the Festival of Unleavened Bread for seven days with joy, because the Lord had made them glad, turning the heart of the king of Assyria toward them and strengthening them for their work on the Temple of God, the God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After all of this, during the reign of King Artaxerxes of Persia, Seraiah’s son Ezra (who was the grandson of Azariah, son of Hilkiah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: son of Shallum, son of Zadok, son of Ahitub,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: son of Amariah, son of Azariah, son of Meraioth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: son of Zerahiah, son of Uzzi, son of Bukki,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: son of Abishua, son of Phinehas, son of Eleazar, son of Aaron the chief priest)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: left Babylon. He was a skillful scribe of the Law of Moses that the Lord God of Israel had given. And the king granted him everything he had requested because the hand of the Lord his God was upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of the descendants of Israel also left for Jerusalem, including the priests, the descendants of Levi, the singers, the gatekeepers, and the Temple Servants, during the seventh year of king Artaxerxes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He arrived in Jerusalem during the fifth month of the seventh year of the king’s reign.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the first day of the first month he left Babylon and he arrived in Jerusalem on the first day of the fifth month, since the beneficent hand of his God was upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Ezra had set his heart to seek the Law of the Lord, to obey it, and to teach God’s statutes and judgments in Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Here is a copy of the letter that King Artaxerxes gave to Ezra, the priest-scribe, a scholar in matters concerning the commandments of the Lord and concerning his statutes pertaining to Israel:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From: Artaxerxes, King of Kings
To: Ezra, the Priest, a scholar in matters concerning the laws of the God of Heaven
Greetings!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I hereby decree that all of the people of Israel—along with their priests and descendants of Levi in my kingdom—who are determined to return to Jerusalem with you may do so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have authority to act for the king and for his Council of Seven to conduct an inquiry concerning Judah and Jerusalem in accordance with the Law of your God, which is in your possession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are carrying silver and gold that the King and his advisors have freely given to the God of Israel, whose Temple is in Jerusalem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: together with all of the silver and gold that you can raise in the province of Babylon, plus the freewill offerings given by the people and the priests, contributed for the Temple of their God, which is in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Accordingly, you are to exercise due diligence to utilize this money to purchase bulls, rams, lambs, grain offerings, and drink offerings, and to offer them upon the altar of the Temple of your God, which is in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Furthermore, the balance remaining of the silver and gold may be used for whatever other purpose you and your people desire, as long as such use is consistent with the will of your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Furthermore, you are to deliver to the God of Jerusalem the vessels for the service of the Temple of your God that have been given to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Furthermore, provide from the royal treasury whatever else may be needed for the Temple of your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I, Artaxerxes, in my capacity as king, hereby decree to all royal treasuries beyond the Euphrates River that whatever Ezra the priest-scribe of the Law of the God of Heaven, may require of you are to be performed with all due diligence,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: up to 100 silver talents, 100 measures of wheat, 100 measures of wine, 100 measures of oil, and salt without limitation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whatever is commanded by the God of Heaven is to be done with all due diligence for the Temple of the God of Heaven, or wrath will come against the king’s realm and his sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Furthermore, we decree that with respect to any of the priests, descendants of Levi, singers, gatekeepers, Temple Servants, or other servants of this Temple of God, it is not to be lawful to impose any tribute, tax, or toll on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you, Ezra, in accordance with the wisdom given to you by your God, are to appoint magistrates and judges to administer justice to all the people beyond the Euphrates River. All of them are to know the laws of your God, and you are to instruct those who do not know them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever refuses to practice the law of your God and the law of the king is to see judgment executed quickly, whether to death, banishment, confiscation of goods, or imprisonment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed be the Lord God of our ancestors,
    who placed this decree into the king’s heart
        to beautify the Temple of the Lord in Jerusalem
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and who showed gracious love to me before the king,
        before his advisors,
        and before all of the king’s mighty officials.
And I was strengthened because the hand of the Lord my God was upon me. So I gathered together the leaders of Israel to go with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the leaders of the families listed among those who left Babylon with me during the reign of King Artaxerxes:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Phinehas’s descendants: Gershom. From Ithamar’s descendants: Daniel. From David’s descendants: Hattush.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Shecaniah’s descendants and from Parosh’s descendants: Zechariah, along with 150 men whose genealogies had been certified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Pahath-moab’s descendants: Zerahiah’s son Eliehoenai and 200 men with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Zattu’s descendants: Jahaziel’s son Shecaniah and 300 men with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Adin’s descendants: Jonathan’s son Ebed and 50 men with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Elam’s descendants: Athaliah’s son Jeshaiah and 70 men with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Shephatiah’s descendants: Michael’s son Zebadiah and 80 men with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Joab’s descendants: Jehiel’s son Obadiah and 218 men with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Bani’s descendants: Josiphiah’s son Shelomith and 160 men with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Bebai’s descendants: Bebai’s son Zechariah and 28 men with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Azgad’s descendants: Hakkatan’s son Johanan and 110 men with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Adonikam’s later descendants: Eliphelet, Jeuel, Shemaiah, and 60 men with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Bigvai’s descendants: Uthai, Zabbud, and 70 men with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I gathered them together at the river that flows toward Ahava, where we camped three days. Afterwards, I examined the people and the priests, but found no descendants of Levi there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I sent for Eliezer, Ariel, Shemaiah, Elnathan, Jarib, Elnathan, Nathan, Zechariah, and Meshullam, who were senior leaders, as well as for Joiarib and Elnathan, who were men of discernment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I told them to go see Iddo, a leader of Casiphia, and tell him and his relatives (administrators of Casiphia) to bring us men who could serve in the Temple of our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By the grace of our God they brought back a discerning man from the descendants of Mahli, a descendant of Israel’s son Levi, along with Sherebiah and eighteen of his sons and brothers;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hashabiah and Jeshaiah from the descendants of Merari and 20 of his brothers and their sons;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: 220 descendants of the Temple Servants whom David and the leaders had appointed to serve the descendants of Levi, listed by name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I called for a fast there at the Ahava River so we could humble ourselves before our God and seek from him an appropriate way for us and our little ones to live, and how we should guard our personal wealth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because I was ashamed to ask the king for a contingent of soldiers and cavalry to protect us from enemies we might encounter on the way. After all, we had told the king, “The hand of our God seeks the good of all who seek him, but his power and anger are against everyone who forsakes him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So we fasted and asked our God about this, and he listened to us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Next I selected twelve of the chief priests—Sherebiah, Hashabiah, and ten of their brothers with them—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and divided between them the silver, the gold, the vessels, and the offering for the Temple of our God which the king had offered, along with his advisors, his senior officials, and all of Israel assembled there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I divided among them 650 silver talents, silver utensils weighing 100 talents, 100 talents of gold,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: 20 gold basins weighing 1,000 darics each, and two vessels made of polished brass, as valuable as gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I told them, “You are consecrated to the Lord, and the vessels are also consecrated. The silver and the gold are a freely given offering to the Lord God of your ancestors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Guard and protect them until you disperse them to the chief priests, the descendants of Levi, and to the family leaders of Israel at Jerusalem in the chambers of the Temple of the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the priests and descendants of Levi took possession of the silver, the gold, and the vessels in order to bring them to Jerusalem, to the Temple of our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then we left the Ahava River for Jerusalem on the twelfth day of the first month. Our God’s protection was with us, and he delivered us from the enemy’s power and from ambush along the way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We arrived in Jerusalem and remained there three days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the fourth day the silver, the gold, and the vessels were distributed at the Temple of our God into the care of Uriah’s son Meremoth the priest, Phinehas’ son Eleazar, Jeshua’s son Jozabad, and Binnui’s son Noadiah, the descendants of Levi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Distribution was according to inventory and weight, with all weights being recorded at that time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of those who had been taken into captivity and who had returned from captivity offered burnt offerings to the God of Israel: twelve bulls for all of Israel, 96 rams, 77 lambs, and twelve male goats as a sin offering—all of them burnt offerings to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they delivered copies of the king’s orders to the king’s officers, and governors on this side of the Euphrates River. The orders were in support of the people and God’s Temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After these things occurred, certain officials approached me and said “The people of Israel, the priests, and the descendants of Levi have not separated themselves from the people of the lands or from the detestable behavior of the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Jebusites, the Ammonites, the Moabites, the Egyptians, and the Amorites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because they and their sons have married foreign women. As a result, the holy people have mingled themselves among the people who live in these lands. As a matter of fact, the senior officials and the rulers have been foremost in this sin.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I heard this, I tore both my garment and robe, plucked hair from both my head and my beard, and collapsed in shock!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then everyone who trembled at the words of the God of Israel gathered together as a group because of the sin committed by those who had been led astray. As for me, I remained seated, in shock, until the evening sacrifice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the time of the evening sacrifice, I arose from my discouragement. Still in my torn garment and robe, I fell to my knees with my hands outstretched to the Lord my God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and said,
“My God, I am too ashamed and hurt to turn to you, because we’re in our iniquities over our heads. Furthermore, my God, our sins have grown as high as the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We have lived in great sin from the days of our ancestors even until today, and because of those iniquities we, our kings, and our priests have been delivered over to foreign kings, for execution, for captivity, for plunder, and for humiliation, as is the case today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Though now, for a moment, grace has been shown from the Lord our God, leaving a few survivors to escape, and providing us a secure hold in his Holy Place, so that our God might enlighten us and give us relief from our servitude.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even though we are slaves, our God has not abandoned us in our slavery. Instead, he has extended gracious love to us in the presence of the kings of Persia, to grant us revival, to set up the Temple of our God, to repair its damage, and to give us a protective wall for Judah and Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, our God, what can we say besides this? Because we have abandoned your commandments
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that you gave in the writings of your servants, the prophets:
‘The land you are entering to possess is a morally unclean land due to the moral uncleanness of the people who live in there—along with their abominations—that has filled it from one end to the other with their impurities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So, therefore, do not give your daughters in marriage to their sons, nor marry their daughters to your sons, and under no circumstances are you to seek their well-being or their wealth, so that you may remain strong, enjoying the best things the land has to give, and so that you may establish an inheritance for your children forever.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “After all that has happened to us because of our evil behavior, and because of our great sin—considering that you our God have punished us less than our iniquities deserve and have given us this deliverance—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: should we violate your commandments by intermarrying with the nations who practice these abominations? Would you not be angry with us until you had consumed us, with not even a remnant surviving to escape?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lord God of Israel, you are just: As a result, we remain here today delivered. Look at us! Because of our sin, we cannot stand in your presence as a result of everything that has happened.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now while Ezra was praying and confessing in tears, having prostrated himself to the ground before the Temple of God, a very large crowd of Israelis—men, women, and children—gathered around him. Indeed, the people were crying bitterly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jehiel’s son Shecaniah, one of Elam’s descendants, responded to Ezra: “We have sinned against our God by marrying foreign wives from the people of the land, but even now there is hope in Israel, despite this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So let’s make a promise to our God by which we divorce all of these foreign wives—as well as those born to them—in accordance with the counsel of our Lord and of those who tremble at our God’s command. Furthermore, let it be done according to the Law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So get up—it’s your responsibility! We’re with you. Be strong, and get to work.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Ezra got up and made the chief priests, the descendants of Levi, and all of Israel vow to carry out everything they promised. And so they agreed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ezra arose in front of the Temple of God to visit the apartment of Eliashib’s son Jehohanan. While there, he neither ate nor drank because he was in mourning over the sins of those who had returned from exile.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they sent word throughout Judah and Jerusalem to everyone who had returned from the exile, to gather together in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever would not come within three days would forfeit his assets and be separated from the community of the returning exiles, just as the high officials and elders had advised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Less than three days later, all of the men of Judah and Benjamin gathered together on the twentieth day of the ninth month. Everyone sat in the plaza of the Temple of God, trembling because of everything that was happening, and also because it was raining heavily.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ezra the priest stood up and spoke to them, “You have sinned by marrying foreign wives, thereby increasing the transgressions of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now confess this to the Lord God of your ancestors, and separate yourselves from the people who live in the land and from foreign wives.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At this, the entire community responded with a loud cry, “We will do just as you’ve spoken!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, many people are involved, and it’s raining heavily. Furthermore, this is not just a matter of a day or two of work, because many of us have sinned in this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So let’s have our officials remain on behalf of the whole community. Then all who have married foreign wives are to come appear at specific times before the elders and judges of each city until the fierce anger of our God has been turned away from us in this matter.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only Asahel’s son Jonathan and Tikvah’s son Jahzeiah opposed this, and they were supported by Meshullam and Shabbethai the descendant of Levi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So those who had returned from exile did this. Ezra the priest and leaders of certain ancestral groups listed by name devoted themselves to examine the situation on the first day of the tenth month.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By the first day of the first month they concluded their investigation of all of the men who had married foreign wives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Here is a list of priestly descendants who were found to have married foreign women. From Jeshua’s descendants: Jozadak’s son and his brothers Maaseiah, Eliezer, Jarib, and Gedaliah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pleading guilty, they promised to divorce their wives. Then they offered a ram from their flocks for their offense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Immer’s descendants: Hanani and Zebadiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Harim’s descendants: Maaseiah, Elijah, Shemaiah, Jehiel, and Uzziah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Pashhur’s descendants: Elioenai, Maaseiah, Ishmael, Nethanel, Jozabad, and Elasah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the descendants of Levi: Jozabad, Shimei, Kelaiah (that is, Kelita), Pethahiah, Judah, and Eliezer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the singers: Eliashib. From the gatekeepers: Shallum, Telem, and Uri.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the Israelis: Parosh’s descendants: Ramiah, Izziah, Malchijah, Mijamin, Eleazar, Malchijah, and Benaiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Elam’s descendants: Mattaniah, Zechariah, Jehiel, Abdi, Jeremoth, and Elijah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Zattu’s descendants: Elioenai, Eliashib, Mattaniah, Jeremoth, Zabad, and Aziza.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Bebai’s descendants: Jehohanan, Hananiah, Zabbai, and Athlai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Bani’s descendants: Meshullam, Malluch, Adaiah, Jashub, Sheal, and Jeremoth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Pahath-moab’s descendants: Adna, Chelal, Benaiah, Maaseiah, Mattaniah, Bezalel, Binnui, and Manasseh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Harim’s descendants: Eliezer, Isshijah, Malchijah, Shemaiah, Shimeon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Benjamin, Malluch, and Shemariah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Hashum’s descendants: Mattenai, Mattattah, Zabad, Eliphelet, Jeremai, Manasseh, and Shimei.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Bani’s descendants: Maadai, Amram, Uel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Benaiah, Bedeiah, Cheluhi,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Vaniah, Meremoth, Eliashib,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Matanza, Maternai, Jas,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bani, Binai, Shihezi,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shelemiah, Nathan, Adaiah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Machnadebai, Shashai, Sharai,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Azarel, Shelemiah, Shemariah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shallum, Amariah, and Joseph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Nebo’s descendants: Jeiel, Mattithiah, Zabad, Zebina, Jaddai, Joel, and Benaiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All of these had married foreign wives, and some of them had children by them.
verses.speaker: Narrator
